intro: Appendicula anceps var. celebica, commonly known as the Celebes appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique floral structure and ornamental appeal.
